titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the German subject collection, 1873-2012
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Brooke Dykman Dockter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-01-15T12:42-0800

change.item: Updated extent statement for additional increment
Revised to update encoding by Samira Bozorgi
updated extent statement for additional increment
Updated extent statement and date range to include new increment
revised after rehousing; updated increment and encoding
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::German Subject Collection)//EN" "reg_101.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 144 manuscript boxes, 1 cubic foot box, 22 oversize boxes, 21 videotape cassettes, 6 phonotape cassettes, 2 phonotape reels, 1 phonorecord, memorabilia.

did.abstract: Pamphlets, leaflets, serial issues, election campaign literature, other printed matter, reports, memoranda, letters, depositions, and miscellany, relating to political, social and economic conditions in Germany, primarily since the German Revolution of 1918, and relating especially to the Weimar period, post-World War II West German elections and student radicalism, the end of the communist regime in East Germany in 1989, the reunification of Germany in 1990, and post-reunification elections.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. Use copies of all sound recordings in this collection are available. To view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], German Subject Collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives. An increment was added in 2011.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, leaflets, serial issues, election campaign literature, other printed matter, reports, memoranda, letters, depositions, and miscellany, relating to political, social and economic conditions in Germany, primarily since the German Revolution of 1918, and relating especially to the Weimar period, post-World War II West German elections and student radicalism, the end of the communist regime in East Germany in 1989, the reunification of Germany in 1990, and post-reunification elections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, pamphlets, leaflets, newspaper issues, posters, arranged alphabetically by subject

did.unittitle: General. Includes material relating to the Berlin war ministry, Kaiser Wilhelm II and the Royal Prussian Academy of the Sciences,
Socialism. Clippings, pamphlets, leaflets, newspaper issues and posters relating to socialist movements and trade unionism in Germany and Switzerland,
WORLD WAR I AND WEIMAR REPUBLIC,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leaflets, proclamations, election pamphlets, flyers, postcards, maps, typescripts, miscellaneous printed matter, newspaper issues, posters, arranged alphabetically by subject

did.unittitle: General. Includes booklets, party membership book and memoranda relating to Gustav Stresemann, the Versailles Treaty, the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk, the Unabhangige Sozialdemokratische Partei Deutschlands and the Saar region,
Berlin. Post-revolution period. Handbills, proclamations, campaign literature, pamphlets, posters, newspaper issues,
Section 4. Formation of the voluntary associations
Section 4. Formation of the voluntary associations
Section 16. The battle over the voting regions
Section 17. Extradition, prisoners of war and refugees
Section 19. Church, school and youth movement
Section 22. Communist movement in the Ruhr
Communism. Includes flyer announcing the assassination of Rosa Luxemburg and Karl Liebknecht, and booklet on German communism, n.d.
National Socialism. Flyers, newspaper issues and Nazi flag
Political campaign literature. Leaflets, posters, pamphlets and other campaign material relating primarily to German elections after World War I, Includes items on Austrian and Swiss elections
General. Includes reports, leaflets, clippings and miscellaneous printed matter,
Polish border. Appeals to German recruits. Postcards
Stuttgart Weltkriegsbucherei. Clippings and transcripts of speeches, relating to the opening of the Stuttgart Weltkriegsbucherei,
Thalmann, Ernst. Leaflets relating to the campaign of Ernst Thalmann, 1932. See also Nazi period, - Anti-Nazi movement
Weimar Republic. Posters, leaflets and clippings arranged numerically in folders according to the original folder number, Please consult the appendix for detailed description
Miscellaneous reports and flyers relating to the war effort, the German Communist Party and materials belonging to the above 246 folders
Postcards of World War I and of prominent revolutionary leaders
THIRD REICH AND WORLD WAR II,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, pamphlets, leaflets, reports, correspondence, printed matter, arranged alphabetically by subject

did.unittitle: General. Clippings, pamphlets relating to social and economic conditions,

Communist Anti-Nazi Propaganda. Camouflaged anti-Nazi pamphlets issued by the Kommunistische Partei Deutschlands. Includes writings by V.I. Lenin, Wilhelm Pieck, Franz Dahlem, Walter Ulbricht, Georgi Dimitroff, Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels,
Dohnanyi, Hans von (1902-1944). Reports and personnel records relating to H. von Dohnanyi and to the relationship between the Abwehr, the Sicherheitsdienst and Wilhelm Canaris,
World War II - Underground movements. Printed leaflet

Banks. "German banks their infiltration, expansion, controlling interest, branches, and subsidiaries in the Banking organizations of occupied, satellite, and other countries", brochure published by National Economic Bank, Poland,
Danzig, Free city of. Travel passports of two Jewish residents illustrating their travels since in search of safe haven
Economy. "Deutschlands Wirtschaftslage in Spaetherbst Fortschreitende Aufrustung". Typescript report, 1933(?)
Education. Holograph essays written by German students in includes essays on contemporary Nazi ideology and German history

Nazi party members. Reports, correspondence and depositions relating to duel fought near Berlin between Horst Krutschinna, Obergebietsfuhrer in the Hitlerjugend and Roland Strunk, Hauptamtsfuhrer in the Schutzstaffel (SS),
Referendum, Printed proclamation relating to the referendum for combining the offices of President and Chancellor
Trade unions. Includes reports from the London based Trade Union Center for German Workers in Great Britain,
Unconditional surrender. "Germany's Record and World Security," United Nations Information Office, Printed report

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, leaflets, proclamations, correspondence, memoranda, transcripts, arranged alphabetically by subject

did.unittitle: General. Includes judicial decisions, pamphlets, reports and leaflets relating to political, social and economic conditions and Allied administration of Germany,
"The Berlin Crisis: A Report on the Moscow Discussions", Printed report
Cabaret, U.S. sector. Songs and libretto of first post-war poltical cabaret,
Leipzig. Proclamations and flyers relating to the administration of the city. Issued by the civilian and military government authorities,
General. Includes copies of prison records of major German war criminals and holograph messages written by them during their trials
Defense . Correspondence, depositions and memoranda relating to the defense of several Germans,
Prosecution. Interrogation reports and transcripts of interrogations of former Nazi officials,
German refugee reports. Reports written by refugees relating to the social and economic conditions in Silesia and East Prussia under Polish and Soviet occupation,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, bulletins, official government publications, communist insignia, propaganda packets, newspaper issues and magazines, pictorial charts, and miscellany printed material, arranged alphabetically by subject

Student protest movement. Periodicals, pamphlets, leaflets, proclamations and posters issued by leftist student groups relating to West German and international political issues, including the West German emergency laws, the publisher Axel Springer, the visit of the Shah of Iran to Berlin, the invasion of Czechoslovakia and the Vietnam War,
Ausserparlamentarische Opposition (APO). See also Universities, Berlin, Freie Universitat; Munich
Allgemeiner Studenten Ausschuss (AStA). See also Universities, Freiburg; Gvttingen; Hamburg; Hanover; Heidelberg; Munich; Stuttgart; Tubingen; and Subject file, Biafra; Emergency laws; Greece
Berlin. See also Universities, Berlin, Freie Universitat)

Gruppe Germanistik, Berlin. See also Universities, Berlin, Freie Universitat

Verband Deutscher Studentenschaft (VDS). See also Universities, Berlin, Freie Universitat; Marburg
Phil-Fak Zeitung. See also Berlin, Freie Universitat
Berkeley, University of California. German radio transcript and rebuttal relating to student unrest on the Berkeley campus, Typescript
Economic policies, See also FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY-Politics and Government-Unification
Deutsche Bank. Includes material on the German Democratic Republic, the Soviet Union, Eastern Europe and German currency unification,
Gewerkschaft Offentliche Dienste, Transport und Verkehr (OTV),
German Democratic Republic. Includes printed copy of the Basic Treaty with the Federal Republic of Germany,
United States, Includes material on the Gulf War
Aussiedler (citizens of eastern and western European nations who are of German ancestry),
Ubersiedler (citizens of the former German Democratic Republic),
Opposition to deployment of nuclear and conventional weapons on German territory,
National socialism. Printed book order lists relating to the role of national socialism during and after World War II,

Terrorism. Includes wanted posters for a group of terrorists led by Willy Peter Stoll, Friedrike Krabbe; Helmut Pohl and others, reports relating to the hijacking of a Lufthansa airplane; and a CDU compilation of references to terrorism,
Arbeitsgemeinschaft Sozialdemokratischer Frauen in der Sozialdemokratische Partei Deutschlands (ASF in der SPD),
Youth movements. Radio broadcast typescripts, published articles relating to the youth movement, the "Wandervogel-Bewegung" and various youth movements after World War II,
Adler, H.C., "Wanderer zwischen den Welten: Die deutsche Jugendbewegung, " broadcast of the Westdeutschen Radio, Koln,
Kayser, Friedrich, "Wandervogel: Idee und Wirklichkeit," broadcast of Sender Freies Berlin, Berlin,
Linz, Gertraud, "Die Erben der 'Blauen Blume,'" broadcast of Hessischen Rundfunk, Frankfurt am Main,
Merlin, Rafael W., "Wandervogel und Blau-Weiss," broadcast of Hessischen Rundfunk, Frankfurt am Main,

Pross, Henry, "Das Gift der blauen Blume," broadcast of Sender Freies Berlin, Berlin,

Schmidt-Zettel, Herbert, "Funfzig Jahre Fahrtenleben mit der Jugend!"
Schmidt-Zettel, Herbert, "Vom Leben der Wandervogel," documentary report,

Thumes, Karl, "Ursprunge und Wurzeln, Anfange und Gestaltungskrafte bundischer Korporationen in Osterreich,"

"Denkmal fur die ermordeten Juden Europas". Documentation on Berlin monument for Jewish holocaust victims,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Flags, stickers, flyers, newspaper issues, calendar, propaganda material, chunks of the Berlin Wall, T-shirts, fragment of Berlin Wall

did.unittitle: Revolution World War I and II propaganda flyers and newspaper issues, two issues of Das 12 Uhr Blatt relating to the assassination attempt on Hitler, ; student revolt material, and SPD calendar,
Ephemeral material relating to the general elections; anti-nuclear propaganda, small chunks of the Berlin Wall; and one reunification T-shirt,

Ephemeral material relating to the elections of the fall of East Germany, unification and anti-fascism. Includes Champagne bottle, T-shirt, small wooden train, Stasi major's epaulettes, flags, stickers, scarves and a unity stamp
Large piece of the Berlin Wall
